citations.narrative:
The facility did not have complete acquisition records for the newly acquired rabbit. Acquisition and disposition records,
including offspring born at the facility, are necessary to accurately track and identify animals being used in regulated
activities, as well as aid in the detection of movement of animals upon relocation to a new site.
The facility shall make, keep and maintain records that fully and correctly include all the required acquisition and
disposition information, including: the name and address of the person from whom the animals were acquired, the USDA
license number of the person if licensed or the vehicle license number and state and driver’s license number and state if
not licensed, the name and address of the person to whom an animal was given/sold, the date of acquisition or
disposition, the species of animal and the number of animals involved.
Correct by September 1, 2023.

The facility has not documented their contingency plan in full to include the required components. A plan is important to
be in place in preparation for unexpected disasters or events, as well a detailed strategy to address the needed handling,
treatment, transportation, housing, and care of the animals in the event of an emergency or disaster. The facility shall
develop and document an appropriate contingency plan available for review upon USDA inspections.
Correct by September 8, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the authorized person.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The facility did not have complete acquisition records for the newly acquired rabbit. Acquisition and disposition records, 
including offspring born at the facility, are necessary to accurately track and identify animals being used in regulated 
activities, as well as aid in the detection of movement of animals upon relocation to a new site.  
The facility shall make, keep and maintain records that fully and correctly include all the required acquisition and 
disposition information, including: the name and address of the person from whom the animals were acquired, the USDA 
license number of the person if licensed or the vehicle license number and state and driver’s license number and state if 
not licensed, the name and address of the person to whom an animal was given/sold, the date of acquisition or 
disposition, the species of animal and the number of animals involved.  
Correct by September 1, 2023. 
2.134 
   
Contingency planning. 
The facility has not documented their contingency plan in full to include the required components. A plan is important to 
be in place in preparation for unexpected disasters or events, as well a detailed strategy to address the needed handling, 
treatment, transportation, housing, and care of the animals in the event of an emergency or disaster. The facility shall 
develop and document an appropriate contingency plan available for review upon USDA inspections. 
Correct by September 8, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the authorized person.
